014package org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.Type;
018import java.util.Arrays;
019import java.util.Objects;
020import java.util.Optional;
021import java.util.Set;
022import java.util.function.Function;
023import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
024
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.AnnotationFactory;
027
028import static java.util.Collections.emptySet;
029
030import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.CollectionCollectors.toUnmodifiableSet;
031
032/**
033 * A {@link java.lang.reflect.Type} qualified by a set of qualifier annotations. Two qualified types are equal to each other
034 * if their {@link #getType()} and {@link #getQualifiers()} properties are equal.
035 *
036 * @param <T> the type that is qualified
037 */
038public final class QualifiedType<T> {
039    private final Type type;
040    private final Set<Annotation> qualifiers;
041    private int hashCode;
042
043    /**
044     * Creates a {@code QualifiedType<T>} for a {@code Class<T>} with no qualifiers.
045     * @param clazz the unqualified type
046     * @return the unqualified QualifiedType
047     * @see #with(Annotation...) to then qualify your type
048     */
049    public static <T> QualifiedType<T> of(Class<T> clazz) {
050        return new QualifiedType<>(clazz, emptySet());
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Creates a wildcard {@code QualifiedType<?>} for a {@link Type} with no qualifiers.
055     * @param type the unqualified type
056     * @return the unqualified QualifiedType
057     * @see #with(Annotation...) to then qualify your type
058     */
059    public static QualifiedType<?> of(Type type) {
060        return new QualifiedType<>(type, emptySet());
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Creates a {@code QualifiedType<T>} for a {@code GenericType<T>} with no qualifiers.
065     * @param type the unqualified type
066     * @return the unqualified QualifiedType
067     * @see #with(Annotation...) to then qualify your type
068     */
069    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
070    public static <T> QualifiedType<T> of(GenericType<T> type) {
071        return (QualifiedType<T>) of(type.getType());
072    }
073
074    private QualifiedType(Type type, Set<Annotation> qualifiers) {
075        this.type = type;
076        this.qualifiers = qualifiers;
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Returns a QualifiedType that has the same type as this instance, but with <b>only</b> the given qualifiers.
081     *
082     * @param newQualifiers the qualifiers for the new qualified type.
083     * @return the QualifiedType
084     */
085    public QualifiedType<T> with(Annotation... newQualifiers) {
086        return new QualifiedType<>(type, Arrays.stream(newQualifiers).collect(toUnmodifiableSet()));
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Returns a QualifiedType that has the same type as this instance, but with <b>only</b> the given qualifiers.
091     *
092     * @param newQualifiers the qualifiers for the new qualified type.
093     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any of the given qualifier types have annotation attributes.
094     * @return the QualifiedType
095     */
096    @SafeVarargs
097    public final QualifiedType<T> with(Class<? extends Annotation>... newQualifiers) {
098        Set<Annotation> annotations = Arrays.stream(newQualifiers)
099            .map(AnnotationFactory::create)
100            .collect(toUnmodifiableSet());
101        return new QualifiedType<>(type, annotations);
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Creates a QualifiedType with the same type as this instance and new qualifiers. Old qualifiers are discarded.
106     *
107     * @return a QualifiedType that has the same type as this instance, but with <b>only</b> the given qualifiers.
108     *
109     * @param newQualifiers the qualifiers for the new qualified type.
110     */
111    public QualifiedType<T> withAnnotations(Iterable<? extends Annotation> newQualifiers) {
112        return new QualifiedType<>(type, StreamSupport.stream(newQualifiers.spliterator(), false).collect(toUnmodifiableSet()));
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Creates a QualifiedType with the same type as this instance and new qualifiers. Old qualifiers are discarded.
117     *
118     * @return a QualifiedType that has the same type as this instance, but with <b>only</b> the given qualifiers.
119     *
120     * @param newQualifiers the qualifiers for the new qualified type.
121     */
122    public QualifiedType<T> withAnnotationClasses(Iterable<Class<? extends Annotation>> newQualifiers) {
123        Set<Annotation> annotations = StreamSupport.stream(newQualifiers.spliterator(), false)
124            .map(AnnotationFactory::create)
125            .collect(toUnmodifiableSet());
126        return new QualifiedType<>(type, annotations);
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Returns the qualified type.
131     *
132     * @return the type being qualified.
133     */
134    public Type getType() {
135        return type;
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Returns a set of qualifying annotations.
140     *
141     * @return the type qualifiers.
142     */
143    public Set<Annotation> getQualifiers() {
144        return qualifiers;
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Apply the provided mapping function to the type, and if non-empty is returned,
149     * return an {@code Optional<QualifiedType<?>>} with the returned type, and the same
150     * qualifiers as this instance.
151     *
152     * @param mapper a mapping function to apply to the type
153     * @return an optional qualified type with the mapped type and the same qualifiers
154     */
155    public QualifiedType<?> mapType(Function<Type, Type> mapper) {
156        return new QualifiedType<>(mapper.apply(type), qualifiers);
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * Apply the provided mapping function to the type, and if non-empty is returned,
161     * return an {@code Optional<QualifiedType<?>>} with the returned type, and the same
162     * qualifiers as this instance.
163     *
164     * @param mapper a mapping function to apply to the type
165     * @return an optional qualified type with the mapped type and the same qualifiers
166     */
167    public Optional<QualifiedType<?>> flatMapType(Function<Type, Optional<Type>> mapper) {
168        return mapper.apply(type).map(mappedType -> new QualifiedType<>(mappedType, qualifiers));
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Returns true if this type contains the given qualifier.
173     *
174     * @param qualifier qualifier to check for.
175     * @return true if this instance contains the given qualifier.
176     */
177    public boolean hasQualifier(Class<? extends Annotation> qualifier) {
178        return qualifiers.stream().anyMatch(qualifier::isInstance);
179    }
180
181    @Override
182    public boolean equals(Object o) {
183        if (this == o) {
184            return true;
185        }
186        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) {
187            return false;
188        }
189        QualifiedType<?> that = (QualifiedType<?>) o;
190        return Objects.equals(type, that.type)
191            && Objects.equals(qualifiers, that.qualifiers);
192    }
193
194    @Override
195    public int hashCode() {
196        int h = hashCode;
197        if (h == 0) {
198            hashCode = h = Objects.hash(type, qualifiers);
199        }
200        return h;
201    }
202
203    @Override
204    public String toString() {
205        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
206        qualifiers.forEach(qualifier -> builder.append(qualifier).append(' '));
207        builder.append(type.getTypeName());
208        return builder.toString();
209    }
210}
